title: Induction - bar on slanted rails in B field

content.description:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

A conducting bar of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"> <mi>m</mi> </math> is placed on two long conducting rails a distance <math alttext="l" overflow="scroll"><mo>ℓ</mo></math> apart. The rails are inclined at an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> with respect to the horizontal and the bar is able to slide on the rails with negligible friction between the bar and rails. The bar and rails are in a uniform and constant magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> oriented perpendicular to the rails. A resistor of resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"> <mi>R</mi> </math> connects the upper ends of the rails and completes the circuit, as shown. The bar is released from rest at the top of the incline.
content.question:
(a) Indicate whether the magnitude of the acceleration of the bar increases, decreases, or stays the same as the bar begins moving down the rails.

_____ Increases          _____ Decreases          _____ Stays the same

Justify your selection without manipulating equations.
